text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['14. makarakep so panganpen', '捉到狐狸', 'We caught foxes', '', 'si apen Ngalaod (F, 58, Yayo)', '王秋閱，女，58，椰油村', '']

S.FORM: yaken rana am, mi-vanoa do dang,
S.TRANSL: 我呢 。那時候是招飛魚祭的日子
As for me. At the time it was the beckoning flying fish ceremony.

S.FORM: “mi ta pa moa-en o ovi ya, ta”, “nohon”, ika-lima ko ji wari mo ji Lakapen,
S.TRANSL: “我們去種一下這些山薯，因為 ”，“好啊” ，當時我正懷著你弟弟si Lakapen五個月
“Let’s go plant yam, because ”“Okay.” At the time I was five months pregnant with si Lakapen.

S.FORM: mi-apid namen a om-angaz rana, m-ian namen do oro-wra da mina Makek do ma-maseveh-an da am,
S.TRANSL: 我們揹著要種的山薯上山去。當我們走到si Makek的芋頭田一帶時
We carried the yam that we were going to plant up the mountain. Once we got to the area of si Makek’s taro fields,

S.FORM: to namen an-pang-i o om-alam a panganpen a, “wo, panganpen!”, “nohon!”,
S.TRANSL: 忽然遇見正走在路上的狐狸，“喔，有狐狸！” “嗯”
we suddenly saw a fox trotting along.“Oh, a fox!” “Yeah.”

S.FORM: “key anong do dang!”, “nohon!”, ka-koa-koan ko a m-awaz am, to ko ma-layo-láyo a,
S.TRANSL: “快呀！它跑到你那裡了！” “是！” 雖然我有孕在身，但我仍用跑的去追那隻狐狸
“Quick! It’s running to you!” “Yes!” Even though I was pregnant, I still ran trying to catch the fox.

S.FORM: ji ko ni-rakep a, o rako a mao am, to ko i pa-pikpik-i so velek ko a, “wo, awalay” koan ko a,
S.TRANSL: 我不但沒有捉到狐狸，而且還讓肚子撞到了大石頭，“喔！天啊！” 我說
I didn’t catch it, but my stomach slammed into a rock. “Ouch!” I cried.

S.FORM: toda angay o pinmatao am, “wo, ya abo rana”, “mo ji ni-ma-rakep ori a, a”,
S.TRANSL: 你已故的父親也跑去捉，“喔，不見了” ，“你沒捉到啊？ ”
Your late father went to catch it. “Oh, it’s gone,” “You didn’t catch it? ”

S.FORM: “pang-ap-i so i-vaod ta sia”, “wo, ta ni-ma-hap ori, alang!”,
S.TRANSL: “拿繩子來綁狐狸吧” ，“喔，我們居然捉到了，太好了”
“Take a rope and tie it up.” “Oh, we caught it, that’s just too good to be true.”

S.FORM: ka-ngaz namen rana, ka-ptad namen no moa-en namen a.
S.TRANSL: 我們繼續上去；然後放下我們要種的山薯
We continued up and put down the yam that we were going to plant.

S.FORM: “imo rana am, ciaha ta ya apereh ya, ma-ngay ko pa ha-hap-en o sinaboay ko do tey-ngato an,
S.TRANSL: “你呢，反正這些（要種的山薯）不多（給你種）。我呢，上去把以前留在那裡的木柴拿下來
“As for you, (you finish planting the rest of the yam) since there are only a few. I will go up to bring down the unsplit wood I left there before.

S.FORM: ma-ngali ka pa so paci-heralay-an ta apéreh a veza-no-dehdeh an”, ka-ngaz na, ka-pa-ngali ko a.
S.TRANSL: 順便挖一點要帶回家的veza no dehdeh芋” 。他就上去了，而我在田裡挖（veza no dehdeh芋）
Go dig up some mountain taro for us to take home.” He went up and I dug up (veza-no-dehdeh taro).

S.FORM: akmi ka-i-nengdeng-an no kan-en am, to ko a-mizing, “ana!”,
S.TRANSL: 大約過了煮一鍋飯的時間，我就聽到他在喊，“喂！”
After about the time it takes to cook a pot of rice [about 20-30 minutes, I heard him yell, “Hey!”

S.FORM: “ikong”, “háp-ey o panontonan a, om-angaz ka, ta ya m-ian so koza”,
S.TRANSL: “什麼事？” “你拿大網袋上來，因為有貓（指狐狸）”
“What?” “Go get the big mesh bag, for there is a cat [meaning a fox.”

S.FORM: “ye, anito jimo, ikong o koza”, “a ci maka-karo am, ji ko imo, cita-i pala!”,
S.TRANSL: “耶？有你個鬼啦，什麼貓？” “萬一它跑掉了，我就把你 ，你試試看
“Yeah? Bullshit, what cat?” “If it gets away, you just wait till I [get you ”

S.FORM: “a i-panci na pa a ikong”, to ko rana ngap-a o panontonan a ka-ngaz ko rana,
S.TRANSL: “既然他這麼說，那可能是真的吧” 。於是我就拿了大網袋上去
“If he put it that way, then it must be real.” I took the big mesh bag to him.

S.FORM: a to ko aong, ta ji na yoba-an o ka-ka-karo da, to ma-la-láyo a.
S.TRANSL: 我哪裡趕得上他。他因為怕它們跑了，所以就都用跑的去（掙搶）追捕狐狸
(After I got up there), there was no way to catch up with him. He was afraid they would all get away, so he kept after them.

S.FORM: maka-navak namen am, to ko a-liliw o ai ko a toda a-sngí-sngit pa, “a ya ni-ma-kongo ori?”
S.TRANSL: 我們跑到一半時，我就感覺到腳底在抽痛，“我的腳怎麼了？”
Halfway there, I suddenly felt a sharp pain in my foot.“What happened to that (my foot)?”

S.FORM: m-ównay am, maka-ranes ko jia am, “angay do tey-ngato ori a, man-ikoan ko pa so vazit,
S.TRANSL: 我追到他以後，（他說）“你去上面，我弄一下這個蔓藤
When I caught up, (he told me), “Go up there, I will do something to the vine.

S.FORM: a si m-ian so om-angaz jimo am rakep-en mo”, “wo!” to ko vawa-a am, ni-pa-cilcil-an na so kapa na.
S.TRANSL: 如果（有狐狸）往你那裡跑你就捉” ，“噢！” 。我打開（樹洞）一看，原來他用雨衣塞住了（洞口）
If any (fox) runs toward you, you catch it.” “Oh!” When I moved aside (what was blocking the hole), (I found that) he had used his raincoat to block (the hole).

S.FORM: to nánang sira am, “ey!” koan ko, ta akma sira i mata no anito a,
S.TRANSL: 忽然牠們（狐狸）跑上來，嚇得我“ㄟ！” 了一聲，因為牠們（的眼睛）像鬼的眼睛一樣
Suddenly a few foxes came up, and I was so frightened that I yelped, “Ayee!” Their eyes looked like the eyes of a demon.

S.FORM: cita-en ko do tey-laod am, ni-ma-maod rana so asa, ka-hap na sia, ka-kozong na sia do panontonan a, ka-pang-hap namen a.
S.TRANSL: 我往下面一看，看見他正在捆綁著一隻狐狸，然後裝在網袋裡
I looked down again and saw that he had already tied one fox up and put it in the bag.

S.FORM: ma-níring ko am, “ya ka-doa araw rana, ya ka-pi-vanoa am, tosia o vaza-vazay do vahay?”
S.TRANSL: 我說“再過兩天就是招魚祭了，全帶回家讓家人當點心（零食）歡喜不是很好嗎？”
“In two more days it is the beckoning flying fish ceremony, so won’t it make everyone happy if we take them all home as snacks?” said I.

S.FORM: “nohon a, m-alas ka, to ta na ngap-a sira”, ka-to namen rana ha-hap-an sia,
S.TRANSL: “好吧，你說的也沒錯，我們就全帶回家吧” 。就這樣，我們（把狐狸）全帶回家了
“Okay, you’re right. Let’s take them all home.” Just like this, we took all of (the foxes) home.

S.FORM: ratateng am, ka-osok namen rana, am-ian namen rana do ni-pa-ngali-an namen am, to ko nita o ai ko am,
S.TRANSL: 我們就下去了。我們到了我們挖（山芋）的地方時，我就看我的腳
We went down. When we passed the place where we were digging up (yam), I looked at my foot.

S.FORM: ta! to da a-gagay no vananay a, “ya ni-ma-kongo o ai mo?” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 呵，腳底被菲律賓朴樹割傷皮肉往外翻了起來，“你的腳怎麼了？” 他說
Wow, on the bottom of my foot was an open wound, slashed by a vananay plant. “What happened to your foot?” he asked.

S.FORM: “a do ya ko ni-angaz-an a ya ko ni-aong-an jimo”,
S.TRANSL: “是我上去追你的時候受傷的”
“I cut it when I chased after you.”

S.FORM: “tang a, ka-namo-námod na?”, “to mo ngapíj-i a, moa-en ko pa ya an?”,
S.TRANSL: “哦，這麼嚴重？” “這些（狐狸）你先揹著，我把這些山芋種完”
“Why is it so bad?” “Carry these [foxes home, and I’ll plant the rest of the yam.”

S.FORM: “to manázovaz, ta ma-nat ko sira ito?”,
S.TRANSL: “你開什麼玩笑？我怎麼可能揹得動牠們啊？”
“What joke are you trying to play? How will I ever be able to carry them?”

S.FORM: “no k-om-oan am, to mo rana angáy-an sira”, “nona”, ka-bezbez na do ka-pi-moa na,
S.TRANSL: “不然這樣好了，你揹它們回去” ，“好吧， ”，他就很快的把山芋種完
“How about this? You take them home.” “Okay ”so he finished planting the yam quickly.

S.FORM: “m-oli ta rana”, “nohon”, m-oli namen rana.
S.TRANSL: “我們回家吧” ，“好” 我們就回家去了
Let’s go home.” “Okay.” We went back home.

S.FORM: maka-ranes namen do vahay ta am, ma-níring si kaka mo si Mivilang ya am, “wo, aro a panganpen! alang” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 我們到家後，你哥哥si Mivilang說“喔！好多的狐狸啊，太好了”
When we got back, your older brother si Mivilang said, “Oh! That is a lot of foxes! Great!”

S.FORM: to na rengey ni maran mo ni Mazat am, to ngai jiamen a, “wo, alang”,
S.TRANSL: 你叔叔si Mazat無意間聽到了也過來，說“喔！太好了！”
Your uncle si Mazat also heard and ran over and said, “Oh! Fantastic!”

S.FORM: “no k-om-oan am, adoa o y-akan takamo a, y-akan takamo cicia-pi-vanoa an?”
S.TRANSL: “既然這樣，在招魚祭的今天，我們就殺兩隻好了”
“How about this? Today we kill two to eat on the day of the beckoning flying fish ceremony.”

S.FORM: “nohon, a ji a-pia ori a”, ka-doa no ni-ma-yakan namen a. ratateng am, ka-kma na sang a,
S.TRANSL: “好啊，這樣也好” 。那天我們就宰殺了兩隻狐狸，就這樣
“Okay, that sounds good.” That day we killed two foxes.

S.FORM: ma-séyrem am, “mi ko pa i-panci si wari ta do Kasawalan a, ta ya m-ian so ya ko i-panci jia”, “nohon”, m-angaz o pinmatao a,
S.TRANSL: 到了晚上，他說“我去叫do Kasawalan團的弟弟來，我有事跟他講” ，“好” ，他就上去了
At night, he said, “I want to go call little brother from the group do Kasawalan, for I have something to say to him.” “Okay.” Then he went up.

S.FORM: “mo ama! ya ka ni-ma-kongo?” koan ko,
S.TRANSL: 我說“爸爸，你怎麼了？”
“Dad, What happened to you?” I said.

S.FORM: to ko nita am, to da viknaz o ai na, “a ya ka ni-ma-kongo ya?”
S.TRANSL: 我一看，原來他腳受傷了。“你怎麼了？”
When I looked, I found that his foot was hurt. “What happened to you?”

S.FORM: “ya ko todey novoz do pa-ka-kan-an da da maran ta do ilaod”, “a ya mo ji a-cita?” “nohon”.
S.TRANSL: “我不小心跌到下面你叔叔他們的豬圈裡” ，“你沒看路？” “嗯”
“I fell accidentally into our uncle’s pigsty.” “You weren’t watching where you were going?” “Nope.”

S.FORM: “yaten rana ya am, ikongo pa o hap-en a? to ko rana pa-kan-a jimo o ya asa ya, o ya asa ya am, ori o”, “nohon”,
S.TRANSL: “我們呢，我沒準備什麼好菜。我呢，（為了可憐你跌倒）就殺了這隻（狐狸）請你吃，另外這一隻 ”，“好吧”
“We don’t have anything special. This one [fox is for you to eat (because you fell), and the other ”

S.FORM: “tosia, ta ma-kaniaw, a m-ian so akma so sang”,
S.TRANSL: “還是不要好了，因為這樣是忌諱的，哪有這樣的？”
“No, this would be taboo and is very strange.”

S.FORM: “tang, na kangay no akma sia s-in-avat a i-pey-’eza”, “nohon”,
S.TRANSL: “啊唷，有什麼關係，我們這樣一起上山捕到這麼多狐狸的情形，也不是常有的事” ，“好吧”
“What does it matter? We have never caught so many foxes together.” “Okay.”

S.FORM: tateng am, ma-ngazapaz ko do dang a, ka-paka-pia namen a ma-mareng do kanen do dang a.
S.TRANSL: 於是我準備了一大竹篩的食物，我們一家人就吃了一天豐富的狐狸大餐
At the time I had prepared a large pot of food, and the entire family ate fox together.

S.FORM: si akes mo ya, ta ji ngian pa jira apen Mangananao ito, a ka-ji namen ni-manci-an nira,
S.TRANSL: 而你祖母當時是住在si apen Mangananao家，因此就沒有叫他們來吃狐狸肉
Your grandmother was still part of si apen Mangananao’s family, so we didn’t ask them to come eat fox with us.

S.FORM: ji a-lla-llag pa o pinmatao, a mang-azaw? a ma-nioy nokakoa?
S.TRANSL: 以前，我的（已故）先生尤其很多禁忌（忌諱），既不會分肉給人家，也不邀請親友們來家裡共享狐狸肉大餐
My late husband was a very superstitious man. Not only did he not split the fox and give it away, but he didn’t even ask friends to come to eat fox with us.

S.FORM: am ori o mina kava-kavavatanen ko nokakoa,
S.TRANSL: 這就是我很久以前的故事
This is a story of my past.

S.FORM: to ko a-niahey-an a, mata no anito koan ko so mata no panganpen, ori rana.
S.TRANSL: 我看到狐狸的眼睛時，以為是鬼的眼睛，害我怕的要死。完了
When I saw the foxes’ eyes, I was frightened and thought I saw a demon. That’s it.

S.FORM: ji ko nita, ta aong-en ko, ta ji ko a-cita do pi-pangay-an na,
S.TRANSL: 我怕看不到他往哪裡去，就拼命的追去，因此沒時間看看（我的腳）
At the time I was so scared I wouldn’t catch up that I didn’t stop to look down (at my foot). I ran with all I had to catch up.

S.FORM: “yaten rana ya am, ya sia anem sira ya am, adoa o i-oli ta, ta mi ko ha-hap-en simaraw” koan na,
S.TRANSL: 他說“我們呢，總共捉了六隻，但我想，我們只帶兩隻回家，明天我再來拿剩餘的”
“We caught six foxes today, but I only want to take two home today.(The rest) we can get tomorrow,” said he.
